subject: Ethics
title: Transitional Justice Models
description: A micro-lesson that makes Transitional Justice Models usable.

hook.text: After a war, what do you do with the soldiers who followed orders and committed atrocities?

buildup.text: Transitional justice includes trials, truth commissions, reparations, and institutional reform.

discovery.text: The Nuremberg Trials set the precedent: 'I was following orders' is not a defense for war crimes.

twist.text: But trying everyone is impossible. Rwanda had 120,000 suspects and only 12 judges after the genocide.

climax.text: They invented gacaca courtsâ€”community justice where neighbors judged neighbors. Imperfect but functional.

punchline.text: Perfect justice after war is impossible. Some justice beats none.

quiz.question: What precedent did the Nuremberg Trials establish?
options: Only heads of state can be tried for war crimes, not ordinary soldiers
Following orders is not a valid defense for committing war crimes
War crimes can only be tried in the country where they occurred
